attributes.action: Abolish VAT on Information and Communications Technology Repair
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We are calling on the Government to acknowledge the value of repair in lowering the carbon footprint of information and communications technology (ICT) by abolishing VAT on the repair of ICT hardware such as servers, routers and telephone systems.

In order to help businesses reduce their e-waste and carbon footprints, the Government should consider providing a tax incentive that allows businesses to take a greener approach to the maintenance of ICT equipment, rather than solely supporting investment in new ‘eco-friendly’ technologies that don’t always deliver the environmental benefits promised.  

While newer products may consume less energy during their working lives, they are actually produced via extremely energy-intensive manufacturing processes.  Consequently, any energy savings realised by the new technology are merely absorbed by the growing footprint of manufacturing it in the first place.

By eliminating VAT on ICT repair, the Government would be taking a huge step towards lowering ICT’s carbon footprint, helping businesses adopt a far more sustainable approach to ICT.
